abstract: Bankers and lawyers said banks competed to see who could hire the most politically connected recent college graduates.
snippet: Bankers and lawyers said banks competed to see who could hire the most politically connected recent college graduates.
lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, Wall Street’s biggest banks have hired the sons and daughters of senior Chinese government officials in the hopes that they can open doors and secure deals in the world’s fastest-growing major economy.

headline.main: Many Wall St. Banks Woo Children of Chinese Leaders
headline.print_headline: Many Wall St. Banks Woo Children of Chinese Leaders
